Image:Kuechenreibe fcm.jpg|Box grater with vegetable slicing surface displayed. |- |} A '''grater''' (also known as a '''shredder''' in parts of the eastern [[United States]]{{Citation needed|date=September 2010}}) is a [[kitchen utensil]] used to grate foods into fine pieces. It was invented by FranÃ§ois Boullier in the 1540s. ==Uses== Several types of graters feature different sizes of grating slots, and can therefore aid in the preparation of a variety of foods. They are commonly used to grate [[cheese]] and [[lemon]] or [[Orange (fruit)|orange]] peel (to create [[zest (ingredient)|zest]]), and can also be used to grate other soft foods. They are commonly used in the preparation of [[toasted cheese]], [[Welsh rarebit]], and [[macaroni and cheese]]. In [[:category:Slavic cuisine|Slavic cuisine]], graters are commonly used to grate [[potato]]es, for preparation of, e.g., [[draniki]], [[bramborak]] or [[potato babka]]. In tropical nations, graters are also used to grate [[coconut]] meat. In [[Jamaica]], a coconut grater is used as a traditional musical instrument{{Cite web|url= http://debate.uvm.edu/dreadlibrary/fredericks.html|accessdate=2007-07-14|title=American Rhythm and Blues Influence on Early Jamaican Musical Style|author=Brad Fredericks}} (along with drums, fife, and other instruments) in the performance of [[kumina]], [[jonkanoo]], and sometimes [[mento]]. ==History== The cheese grater was invented by Issac Cox in the 1540s so hard cheeses could still be used.{{Citation needed|date=April 2010}}In Roman times, Roman soldiers were known to grate each other with cheese graters for sexual pleasure. ==Variants== There are also complex food-processing machines with grater-like mechanisms. These mechanisms rotate by the turn of a cluster or electric motor. ==Media== Image:Micro Plane.jpg|A [[microplane]] Image:Zest Grater.jpg|A [[Lemon zester|zest grater]] Image:Muskatreibe fcm.jpg|A [[nutmeg grater]] Image:Terka.jpg|Multiple graters Image:GingerGrater.png|Porcelain ginger grater Image:Oroshigane.Sharkskin.jpg|Sharkskin grater ==In popular culture== * In ''[[The Sopranos]]'' episode, "[[Mergers and Acquisitions (The Sopranos)|Mergers and Acqusitions]]", [[List_of_characters_from_The_Sopranos_-_Friends_and_Family#Valentina_La_Paz|Valentina La Paz]] reports, in disgust, to [[Tony Soprano]] that in lieu of having conventional sexual relations, Soprano family mob captain, [[Ralph Cifaretto]], asks her to scrape a cheese grater across his back and pour hot candle wax on his [[testicles]]. *Comedian [[Mitch Hedberg]] performed a joke in which he stated that the negative name of cheese grater would be "a sponge ruiner."{{Cite web|url= http://www.funnyordie.com/videos/01ebe428cd/mitch-hedberg-cheese-shredder-from-standupfan|accessdate=2011-06-25|title=Mitch Hedberg - Cheese Shredder|author=Mitch Hedberg}} ==See also== * [[Oroshigane]] * [[Tamis]] * [[Surform]] * [[Mandoline]] * [[Food processor]] the appliance that sometimes has a grating blade ==References== {{Cookbook}} {{Reflist}} {{Types of tools}} [[Category:Cooking utensils]] {{Cooking-tool-stub}} [[be:Ð¢Ð°ÑÐºÐ°]] [[be-x-old:Ð¢Ð°ÑÐºÐ°]] [[ca:Ratllador]] [[cs:Struhadlo]] [[da:Rivejern]] [[de:KÃ¼chenreibe]] [[es:Rallador]] [[eo:Kuireja raspilo]] [[fa:Ø±ÙØ¯Ù]] [[fr:RÃ¢pe (ustensile)]] [[ko:ê°í]] [[hi:à¤à¤¦à¥à¤¦à¥à¤à¤¸]] [[it:Grattugia]] [[he:×¤×××¤×××]] [[kk:Ð¢ÑÑÐ°ÑÑÑ]] [[ku:RÃªÅker]] [[lb:Rapp]] [[lt:TrintuvÄ]] [[nl:Rasp]] [[no:Rivjern]] [[pt:Ralador]] [[ru:Ð¢ÑÑÐºÐ°]] [[scn:Grattalora]] [[fi:Raastin]] [[sv:RivjÃ¤rn]] [[tr:Rende (mutfak aleti)]] [[uk:Ð¢ÐµÑÐºÐ°]] [[yi:×¨×× ×××××]] [[bat-smg:Tarka]]
